Package org.javautil.commandline.annotations

Special annotations package providing advanced command-line parameter validation.

See:
          Description

Annotation Types Summary
AcceptableValues Annotation type to indicate a list of values that may be assumed by a String, usually used as a parameter to the command line.
DependentField Annotation type to indicate a parameter is required by another parameter.
DirectoryExists Annotation type to indicate a directory must exist.
DirectoryReadable Annotation type to indicate a directory must be readable.
DirectoryWritable Annotation type to indicate a directory must be writable.
Exclusive Annotation type to indicate a parameter is exclusive to another parameter.
FieldValue Annotation type to assign a command line parameter type to a bean property.
FileExists Annotation type to indicate a file must exist.
FileReadable Annotation type to indicate a file must be readable.
FileWritable Annotation type to indicate a file must be writable.
Hidden Annotation type to indicate that an argument is hidden; that is, not displayed on help messages.
MultiValue Annotation type to indicate a parameter is accepted multiple times.
Optional Annotation type to indicate a parameter should be treated as optional.
Required Annotation type to indicate a parameter should be treated as required.
RequiredUnless Annotation type to indicate a parameter should be treated as required unless another parameter is specified.
Requires Annotation type to indicate a parameter is required by another parameter.
StringSet Annotation type to indicate a list of values that may be assumed by a String, usually used as a parameter to the command line.
 

Package org.javautil.commandline.annotations Description

Special annotations package providing advanced command-line parameter validation.
